meanings.definition: To throw (someone) out of a window.
meanings.sent1: The villain defenestrated the hero from the top floor.
meanings.sent2: The cat accidentally defenestrated the vase while playing near the window.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel defenestrated the acorn out of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind defenestrated the leaves from the branches.
meanings.sent5: The angry mob defenestrated the corrupt official for his crimes.

meanings.definition: To remove or dismiss (someone) from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The board defenestrated the CEO due to financial mismanagement.
meanings.sent2: The teacher defenestrated the student council president for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent3: The king defenestrated the jester for telling a bad joke.
meanings.sent4: The company defenestrated the manager for unethical behavior.
meanings.sent5: The committee defenestrated the chairman after a vote of no confidence.
